alert.note: Alert for Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Southern Oneida (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 7:26PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Oneida, northwestern Madison and northeastern Onondaga Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 725 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bridgeport to Wampsville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rome, Sullivan, Oneida, Lenox, Lee, Verona, Westmoreland, Vienna, Chittenango and Canastota. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 32 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Southern Oneida
